page.title: 06Framlingham, Thomas Mills.
page.content: Thomas Mills died a rich man in 1703 and was buried in his own garden. The tomb is still visible from Station Road. In his will he left money for 8 almshouses to be built; they stand at the side of the Tomb House. He also left money for a grammar school to be built. In 1978 a comprehensive school called Thomas Mills High School was opened and the old grammar school was sold for $60,000. A large plot of land beside the almshouses has been sold and 101 houses are being built there. The trust also owns other pieces of farming land in the area. There is $450,000 in the trust now and this money is invested. It is used to maintain, heat, light and insure the almshouses. At the moment they are being extensively modernised. Trust money is also granted to Thomas Mills High School. Interview with Mr.M.Ashwell, Chairman of Trust.
